seriesJson.title: Ideas and the Theatre
seriesJson.description: The series presents a discussion of the current American theatre; its values, beliefs, patterns, and problems. Participants include Arthur Miller, Eric Bentley, Gore Vidal, Brooks Atkinson, Cyril Ritchard, Clinton Wilder, Tennessee Williams, and others.

node.title: Sex, fun and Jean Anouilh's waltz
node.description: A discussion of sex and how it is explored in theater, with a particular focus on Jean Anouilh's play "Waltz of the Toreadors."

subject.name: Anouilh, Jean, 1910-1987. Valse des tore_adors. English

node.title: George Bernard Shaw
node.description: This program focuses on the dramatic works of George Bernard Shaw.

node.title: Tennessee Williams
node.description: This program focuses on the work of Tennessee Williams and includes Williams' own thoughts on the matter.

node.title: Is the Theatre an influence?
node.description: A discussion of modern theater and whether or not it has an impact on modern society. Featured speakers include Gore Vidal, Tennessee Williams and Cyril Ritchard.

node.title: Freud, Psychoanalysis, and Broadway
node.description: This program discusses the influence of Freud and psychoanalysis on 20th century theater.

node.title: The despair and religion of Eugene O'Neill
node.description: This program explores the worls of Eugene O'Neill.

node.title: A matter of hopelessness: Arthur Miller and "Death of a Salesman."
node.description: This program focuses on the importance of Arthur Miller and his play "Death of a Salesman."

node.title: Where the artist is the enemy
node.description: This program, "Where the Artist is the Enemy," analyzes Gore Vidal's play, "Visit to a Small Planet."

node.title: Social guilt in drama
node.description: This program focuses on "Social Guilt in Drama."

node.title: Can we have ideas in the Theatre?
node.description: This program features a variety of contributors, like Gore Vidal, Brooks Atkinson, and Solon Kimball, asking if theatre can foster and promote new ideas in society.

node.title: T.S. Eliot
node.description: This program focuses on the dramatic works of T.S. Eliot.

node.title: Religious drama
node.description: An examination of the theme of religion as used in drama in the mid-20th century.
